channel.title: 64 Bit client's
channel.description:
Noob question really sorry, but, how do I change a 32bit client into a a 64bit compatible client? For my friends/other players 64bit client's
Here's the clients run so far:-
@echo off title My Client java -Xmx500m Jframe 10 0 highmem members 32 pause
Here's what i've tryed changing it to for 64bit:- @Echo off title My 64bit (x86) Client Cd "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\Javaw.exe" -Xmx254m -classpath .;Theme.jar Gui 0 0 lowmem members 32 exit
It simply says to that, "could not find main class gui"
Any help please?
Also, any idea what i need to do to make the server sided "run" work on a 64bit? currently says :-
@echo off title My server java -Xmx800m -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar; server.Server pause
What would i do to make it work on 64bit?

item.title: 64 Bit client's
item.dc:creator: @Vince2 Vince,
item.description:
@Vince2 wrote:

[quote=“Radars, post:4, topic:375501”][quote author=Vince, link=topic=471441.msg3448223#msg3448223 date=1293568365]
And nothing about RSPS is 64 bit, all 32 bit.
[/quote]

Lol, but the system they are running on are (clients), and they close as soon as you move if you don’t do the 64 bit fix.

For me:

// 32 bit run.bat @echo off title SimpleScape java -Xmx300m Jframe 10 0 highmem members 32 pause

// 64 bit run.bat @echo off title SimpleScape "C:/Program Files (x86)/Java/Jre6/bin/java.exe" -Xmx300m Jframe 10 0 highmem members 32 pause[/quote]

Most people are using 64bit Java though, which is the main cause of why it crashes.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Radars wrote:

Vince:

And nothing about RSPS is 64 bit, all 32 bit.

Lol, but the system they are running on are (clients), and they close as soon as you move if you don’t do the 64 bit fix.

For me:

// 32 bit run.bat @echo off title SimpleScape java -Xmx300m Jframe 10 0 highmem members 32 pause

// 64 bit run.bat @echo off title SimpleScape "C:/Program Files (x86)/Java/Jre6/bin/java.exe" -Xmx300m Jframe 10 0 highmem members 32 pause

item.title: 64 Bit client's
item.dc:creator: @Vince2 Vince,
item.description:
@Vince2 wrote:

[quote=“Evoked Ko, post:1, topic:375501”]Noob question really sorry, but, how do I change a 32bit client into a a 64bit compatible client?
For my friends/other players 64bit client’s

Here’s the clients run so far:-

@echo off
title My Client
java -Xmx500m Jframe 10 0 highmem members 32
pause

Here’s what i’ve tryed changing it to for 64bit:-
@Echo off
title My 64bit (x86) Client
Cd
“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\Javaw.exe” -Xmx254m -classpath .;Theme.jar Gui 0 0 lowmem members 32
exit

It simply says to that, “could not find main class gui”

Any help please?

Also, any idea what i need to do to make the server sided “run” work on a 64bit?
currently says :-

@echo off
title My server
java -Xmx800m -cp bin;deps/poi.jar;deps/mysql.jar;deps/mina.jar;deps/slf4j.jar;deps/slf4j-nop.jar;deps/jython.jar;log4j-1.2.15.jar; server.Server
pause

What would i do to make it work on 64bit?[/quote]

@echo off title Run Client "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe" -Xmx512m Jframe 10 0 highmem members 32 pause

And nothing about RSPS is 64 bit, all 32 bit.

Read full topic

item.title: 64 Bit client's
item.dc:creator: @ezbeni ezbeni
item.description:
@ezbeni wrote:

“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe”
Try that, not sure though

Read full topic
